findings.title: Function voteOnModerationRequest() counts None votes as Yea votes.
findings.description: The function voteOnModerationRequest() will count any None vote as a Yea vote, which can result in a moderation request being approved without any participating members voting as Yea.

findings.title: performTransfer() can potentially fail if it transfers ETH to a smart contract
findings.description: The function performTransfer() calls transfer() to send ETH to txn.destination, which only forwards 2300 gas. In cases where txn.destination is a smart contract whose fallback function consumes more than 2300 gas, the call will always fail.

findings.title: Moderator count not enforced
findings.description: The moderator count is not consistently enforced which can lead to the condition of at least 4 moderators (2 directors not being met) and `getMemberCount()` returning an incorrect result.

findings.title: Potential directorCount mismatch when adding/deleting directors
findings.description: When adding a director that has already been added before, `directorCount` will be inconsistent with the actual number of directors. Furthermore, if two or more moderation requests are made to delete the same director and all get approved, `directorCount` will also be incorrect.

findings.title: Missing require error message in cancelModerationRequest()
findings.description: Function `cancelModerationRequest()` is missing an error message for `require(moderationRequest.state == TxState.Active)`.
